text: NICKI SHIELDS: Hello and welcome
in Las Vegas.

Now, this weekend,
the Formula E drivers

are going head to head with
video gamers in a new racing
format in the virtual world.

And one of those drivers
is Nelson Piquet, Jr,

who joins me here
in a place that I

believe has got some rather
special memories for you.

Piquet Jr. won the NASCAR
truck rally on this very track

How big is the
engine in a NASCAR?

NELSON PIQUET JR: It's
a 700 horsepower--
750 horsepower engine.

NICKI SHIELDS: So you're
[inaudible] 750 horsepower
V8 for an electric segue!
You won back here in 2012.

But it was pretty
spectacular win.
Tell us what happened.

NELSON PIQUET JR: Yeah, it
was my second NASCAR win,

but it was in a
very, very cool way.

I was heading up to
pass Matt Crafton.

I was trying to pass
him for like 15 laps,
and I couldn't pass him.

The last lap, I'd really
dive bombed into the inside
and managed to make the pass.

And I hold him up the back
straight and came back,
and I won the race.
And it was an amazing feeling.

NICKI SHIELDS: Piquet Jr. is
used to last minute triumphs.

He clinched the
Formula E season one

championship in the very last
turn of the very last race.

NELSON PIQUET JR: I hadn't
driven an open wheel

since a couple of
years, so I thought

it was going to take a
little bit of getting used

to it again, but we
won it straight away,

and it was another amazing
point in my career.

NICKI SHIELDS: I will say,
you've just got to look
at the angle of this track.
It is absolutely ridiculous.

NELSON PIQUET JR: And the fun
part-- a lot of the times,

we are scraping the
top wall with the car,

and it's just an amazing
feeling because you're
so close to the wall.

We're driving at about
200 miles an hour.
And it's just--
NICKI SHIELDS: It's terrifying.
NELSON PIQUET JR: It's lovely.
It's a great venue.
I love this place.

My dad won his first
world championship
in Caesar's Palace, Formula 1.

So we have a bit of
history over here already.

NICKI SHIELDS: So we've got
the Vegas eRace this weekend.

Do you think you
can really compete
against the video gamers?

NELSON PIQUET JR:
I think there's

no reason why us
drivers shouldn't
give them a hard time.

NICKI SHIELDS:
Well, Nelson, thank

you so much for showing
me around the Las
Vegas Motor Speedway.

It is a ridiculous venue, and
it's been a real privilege
to be on a segue with you.
Good luck this weekend.

NELSON PIQUET JR:
It was a pleasure.

I hope to have another
win in Vegas now.

NICKI SHIELDS: Should
we got for a race?
NELSON PIQUET JR: Sure.
